website_summaries.verdict: An acceptable middle-of-the-road Canon printer. It stands out for offering numerous functions in a small design.
pros: Multifunctional model in a space-saving design
Lighter, more streamlined than costlier options
Nice print quality for a mid-range price
cons: Paper has the tendency to jam in the unit
Scanning and copying components feel flimsy

customer_reviews.title: Paper Jams continuously ..
customer_reviews.text: This is a horrible printer. It paper jams continuously and I have had more frustrations with it than I did with my old reliable Cannon.This is just impossible and the view area for info is dark and what you can see is no help what so ever. OK it was cheaper than others but some of the reviews were great that is why I purchased, such a big mistake! Please do not waste your money on this.
customer_reviews.author: perry

customer_reviews.title: Nice to print wirelessly
customer_reviews.text: It took me awhile to get this going wirelessly, but I found a video that walked me through the set up and that helped. It is very nice to be able to print without all the wires. Good quality prints, too. I haven't used the scanner or copier yet, but they will come in very handy. I expect I won't often use the fax feature. But it is nice to have. Glad I went for it and got an "all-in-one". The quality seems to be as good as my former HP printer and the cartridges aren't any higher in price.
customer_reviews.author: Blue DragonflyTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Handy wireless printer.
customer_reviews.text: Had to use the manual connection setup menu to connect to my Uverse router, but the whole process took less than 5 minutes. Two laptops, one notebook and three phones successfully connected and printing. The print quality is great and the replacement ink is affordable.
customer_reviews.author: L. Marruquin

customer_reviews.title: This printer is a piece of garbage. It doesn't easily connect to the internet and ...
customer_reviews.text: This printer is a piece of garbage. It doesn't easily connect to the internet and disconnects very often. There is a weird way to connect to the internet, which is not mentioned in the instructions. Each time it asks for the internet password, but it is not easy to type in numbers or lower case letters (you have to play around to figure it out). Instructions are absurd and insufficient. After calling the manufacturers, I finally connected the printer to the internet. The printer did not even last 2 days. It started jamming and making a lot of noise. I spent hours trying to fix it. It was a waste of time. The worst printer I have ever had.
customer_reviews.author: FERA

customer_reviews.title: Don't buy; ink cost is absurdly high!
customer_reviews.text: The printer works fine for one at this price, but the ink is prohibitively expensive...costs more than the printer itself. Advice: do a cost per page search for printer in the price range you want to spend. I just replaced the Canon with a Brother. The Brother installed more easily, cartridges are much less expensive, and the unit is sturdier, etc., and the cost per page is MUCH better. For Canon's $39 you get what you pay for, which is not much, but worse, it's an ink trap.
customer_reviews.author: omisamoyed

customer_reviews.title: Ehhh, I would go for something better.
customer_reviews.text: This is good for small print jobs. Everytime I want to print over 5 pages (Which is common as a college student since I will have to print out my papers and reading assignments), the ink decides to stop. I still have a nearly full cartridge of ink and it stops half way and just releases my half empty sheet. You will have to print in increments of 1-4 pages at a time which can be time consuming if you are in a rush.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Big black box of useless
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer to replace one that was stolen. I tried to install and connect this printer to my computers. One tower and three laptops. Two of my computers can not find this on the network and it will not allow me to scan from any computer. I now have a big black paper holder on my desk. I am very disappointed with this printer and Canon is of no help.I would return this but after working with Canon I believe my return window has expired.
customer_reviews.author: Eric Pelto

customer_reviews.title: Do Not Buy if On a Mac
customer_reviews.text: Works awfully with MacOS. Printing is noisy and slow. Scanner interface is the worst part - constant WiFi issues, and upon scanning (and the long time it takes for it to actually scan) the process will be interrupted with a "Cannot communicate with scanner" prompt. I've checked online and numerous people are having the same issue. No wonder there are no Canon printers for sale on the Apple Store - clearly Apple knows they're a bad match.
customer_reviews.author: Bruyn

customer_reviews.title: So far it is great ...and scans wirelessly
customer_reviews.text: So far I love it. The installation was not bad. Not harder than what many printers are like now when you have to download drivers online. I was worried about scanning like many people here and had purchased a wire (usb printer type )as few people had complained and had said it needed a wire to scan but it wasn't there. Umm so far, it doesn't need a wire to scan if installed correctly. It even has an automatic feeder to take in the multiple pages for scanning. The usual printing and copying are also great for a printer it's size. There is a reason it's a best seller. I will just wait to see if this lasts...
customer_reviews.author: zebrafatechanged

customer_reviews.title: So not worth the hassle
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for just over a year. It's not very good. I don't use it often but when I do it's a struggle. The ink doesn't show up, it drops wifi connection, it wont link up to my phone. You get the picture. Every single time I go to use it, it's an epic adventure (and not in a good way!)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boy that felt good. Bought this in December and nothing but headaches
customer_reviews.text: Piece of junk. Always has error messages when u try to do ANYTHING with this sorry excuse for a printer. I took a baseball bat to it today, wanted to make sure it was not a thorn in anyone else's side. Boy that felt good. Bought this in December and nothing but headaches. I used to like Cannon printers, but I feel that Cannon is no longer the printer for me since they chose to put out garbage like this. DO NOT BUY THIS JUNK UNLESS U TAKE PLEASURE IN FIGHTIG WITH ELECTRONICS TO TRY AND GET THEM TO WORK RIGHT. I tried to put No stars, but Amazon won't let me.
customer_reviews.author: shane hawkins

customer_reviews.title: We own THREE of this exact model we love it so much
customer_reviews.text: We have loved this printer so much that we actually own THREE of the exact same one. It makes it so much easier to walk another family member through any maintenance or ink changes when you have the same one on your desk. I recommend you change the ink setting to DRAFT to save money. I love that it is compact yet still prints double-sided. It is an air printer so we print directly from our phones, ipads, laptops, desktops - everything. Just love, love, love this printer. I highly recommend if you are looking at an inkjet.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Chalker

customer_reviews.title: Issue with alignment RESOLVED with "Cleaning Encoder Film"!
customer_reviews.text: Had a huge problems with print alignment after installing new ink. I aligned and realigned several times (automatic wouldn't work-error 2900, and manual didn't help). Finally after coming to Amazon to leave a 1-star review, I searched other low star reviews to see if they had the same alignment issues I was having. I saw several (some even gave up and bought a new printer) and I stumbled across a 2-star that said the "encoder film" needed cleaned. I googled "Clean my encoder film for canon mx492" and after finally finding and cleaning the clear, thin strip with a flashlight, everything is working correctly. I didn't even have to realign again after cleaning it with nail polish remover.
customer_reviews.author: Kellie Colaner

customer_reviews.title: Good All-In-One Printer
customer_reviews.text: I bought the MX992 to replace an older non-functioning Canon printer. The printer is inexpensive, but the ink is not. 3rd party cartridges are available however but not at much of a price drop from the manufacturer's originals. The printer 's functions are all very good, making this model a very good printer for light use. The only complaint I have is that if your eyesight is not as good as it once was, this is a difficult printer to operate. the printer and button labels are dark and the small screen is almost unreadable and not bright enough to make the text legible. I have use a flashlight to read it. Bright lighting in your room is a necessity.
customer_reviews.author: O Shepard

customer_reviews.title: Pretty solid printer
customer_reviews.text: Pretty solid printer. It's a bit bigger/bulkier than you'd expect, but I was able to unpack it, connect it to 2 PCs, 1 Mac, 2 iphones and 1 samsung galaxy phone within 30mins, and printed from each device without issue, no cables and wires needed. For $35, you really can't go wrong - even if I have to replace it in 18months, it'll have done it's job. I'm an IT Pro, and have done various printer installs in corporate environments and home-use; this is one of the easiest I've done.
customer_reviews.author: Roger

customer_reviews.title: Not sure why people are having problems
customer_reviews.text: Not sure why people are having problems with this printer I've had it for over 2 years and it's still printing. I use it almost every day. The ink is still expensive but what ink isn't? I've used it to scan and print and no problems. I change computers and internet and then it was somewhat difficult to setup with the new internet but then my son got it working with a older computer but my new dell I didn't have to do much but set it up sitting in bed with the computer and install the software and it automictically set it up. The only thing is I want to scan negatives and not sure if it will work.
customer_reviews.author: Tennessee Kidd

customer_reviews.title: Just as Advertised - Recommended
customer_reviews.text: Product was delivered on time as usual through Amazon. All functions work good as advertised (haven't used fax function as faxes are as ancient as a Sphinx Pyramid in Egypt). I read all the gripes like the top is flimsy, yes it's not a Cadillac door, and all the other minor gripes. What does one expect, a Cadillac at a Volkswagen price (mine was $45 here on Amazon w/free shipping)? You nay sayers need to get a life or better yet open your fat wallet and buy a Lincoln Continental. Product recommended.
customer_reviews.author: BFL

customer_reviews.title: My Favorite Printer
customer_reviews.text: Background: This is David A. Cox. I am the CEO of Tech Talk America and I am one of the top Apple tutorialists on YouTube. I love this printer and recommend it publicly on my website. Printers are one of those things where 99% of what's out there is absolute crap. This printer does exactly what it claims and it does so at a very minimal cost both in the initial purchase and down the road with very reasonably priced ink. Big fan.
customer_reviews.author: Tech Talk America

customer_reviews.title: Insanely frustrating
customer_reviews.text: Easily the most frustrating printer I've ever had, and that's saying a lot. As far as the quality of printing it provides, everything is fine. WHEN you can get it to print, that is. This printer requires me to reinstall drivers, remove the device from my printer network, reconnect it with my WiFi and restart my computer about 6 times EVERY time I want it to print. It continually "re-installs" itself as another "form" of printer, and I have to delete it and get it to reinstall the correct way every time. It takes me an hour to print things every single time. Garbage. Don't bother.
customer_reviews.author: kaylynnschuetz

customer_reviews.title: Good
customer_reviews.text: The set up was easy. Takes a little bit of thinking but it was easy enough. The part where the buttons are is loose, not sure if it's supposed to be like that but it doesn't interfere with anything. For the price you get a good product that does a lot. Get it hooked up to the wifi and this printer is golden. Super easy to hook up to a smart phone, just be on the same wifi. This is what came with it.
customer_reviews.author: Soccernation

customer_reviews.title: Works great for Chrome book
customer_reviews.text: Works great for Chrome book! Nothing in the instructions or on Chrome book really tell you how to set it up so it took a while to set up. I followed all instructions the printer came with to set it up to Google Cloud. Then on Chrome on the computer you go to settings, advanced, printers, Google Cloud printer to set up. It prints great and so far the ink quality is good. I only deducted a star because of the confusing instructions about setting it up with Chrome book.
customer_reviews.author: Crocker

customer_reviews.title: Won’t print color
customer_reviews.text: Set up wasn’t to bad just had to follow directions! It prints beautifully in black and white pictures are amazing but I cannot get it to print in color everything comes out black and white which it looks good but I don’t want all my pictures to be black and white the ink cartridge is working I did the print alognment stuff and that printed colors but that’s it nothing else comes out in color wish I hadn’t ordered this printer I feel like I wasted my money I needed the pictures by Sunday probably not going to happen now
customer_reviews.author: Starr Westwood

customer_reviews.title: Great little desk printer/copier
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for my use. I just needed a small desk printer for my office at work. We have a network printer that I do most of my stuff on but the network one cannot do envelopes and there are times I have sensitive papers I just don't want laying on the network printer until I am able to retrieve them from the other office. This fit's the bill. If I need to do a quick single copy job it works and I don't have to leave my office. I don't use the Fax portion because it's not on the network so I can't comment on that. But for printing and copying. It seems good enough for the job..
customer_reviews.author: Francis J. Schirck III

customer_reviews.title: This printer is fantastic and does everything I need and more
customer_reviews.text: This printer is fantastic and does everything I need and more. I have no problem with the paper feed. I added 20 pages, and a few had been wet at one time, and they went through perfectly. Two pages stuck the first time, but I just wrinkled the edge slightly, and that fixed it. I love the options menu. I have not found a single thing I do not like about this printer so far. It is easy to set up, easy to use, and has so many options that I many never use them all.
customer_reviews.author: zakoka

customer_reviews.title: Absolutely Do Not Buy.
customer_reviews.text: This thing is flat out a piece of garbage. I've had to re-install the drivers for this machine four times....the user interface of which looks and acts like it's from Windows 95. Wired or wireless, it doesn't print. I constantly get "another computer is using the printer" errors every time I try to print. (...there's no other printer.) The only way I was able to get it to print was by manually shutting down a "print spooler process" deep within the Services tab inside the Task Manager. The best part about using this printer was getting it back into the box for a return. Seriously...stay away.
customer_reviews.author: Peter James Zielinski

customer_reviews.title: Don’t buy this, you will regret it.
customer_reviews.text: Canon has a good name so I purchased this printer. It printed the code at the beginning and never printed again. So I took it to Best Buy to the geeks and they couldn’t fix it. So stupidly I purchased another canon, good product name, right? It never worked either! I was told by the salesman to purchase another company’s they always worked. So I did. $between 3 and 4 hundred dollars down the drain and frustrated, with no work done either. Ugh!
customer_reviews.author: loves books

customer_reviews.title: Terrible
customer_reviews.text: This printer is awful. It runs out of ink literally every five pages we print. I seriously have to buy new cartridges every month, which is a total waste of my time and money. I'm not sure why it uses ink so quickly... I do hear it adjusting or calibrating itself randomly throughout the day or night, so maybe that uses up the ink quicker. I absolutely recommend to find a printer with better ratings and better tech support. They do not care that their printer burns through ink faster than it should.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Fisher

customer_reviews.title: Trash and Cheap
customer_reviews.text: I thought I was getting a good deal for $40 but I should have just paid more. The printer is cheap and feels like it's going to break when setting it up and taking off the tapes. Also, its supposed to be cloud ready, but when i try to register it, the site tells me the link is broken. So I can connect to chrome because I need to register the printer first, but the Canon register site link is broken...and it was just a waste of time. Returning.
customer_reviews.author: LE

customer_reviews.title: NOT a wireless printer
customer_reviews.text: Supposed to be a WIRELESS printer but you have to have the usb cord for it to actually print My router is less than a foot from the printer, my pc less than 3 feet from router---printer shows on network but won't print---when going through troubleshooting steps, you have to connect via usb ---not actually wireless if you have to connect via usb....support is non-existent--online links send you into a loop of repeated troubleshooting steps--and then tells you to connect usb cable (which is NOT included) No idea of print quality since it won't print. Also--not that small---same size as my old HP---which i'm going to have to hook back up in order to print
customer_reviews.author: AmyCQ

customer_reviews.title: Terrific small all-in-one
customer_reviews.text: Great small all-in-one printer that fits perfectly on a small filing cabinet I have in a narrow space (see picture). Quick wireless set up. Printing is a little slower than larger unit I owned, but for my purposes now, it works for me. Great price for what you get! Of course, the ink cartridge will be expensive, but for my limited use, they will last much longer.
customer_reviews.author: 8banana

customer_reviews.title: Ink won’t last long
customer_reviews.text: I liked the printer up until I learned that it nots good on ink. The ink lasted me less than 100 pages. I only use this printer to print labels and twice to print out my taxes. They sell the printer cheap but the cost of ink is just as much or more.
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Jay

customer_reviews.title: Manufactured Obsolescence to force you to buy a new printer
customer_reviews.text: Two years after buying this printer, it's started acting up. The scanner won't work, the printer head is suddenly "misaligned" and none of the trouble-shooting works. I've used it very infrequently, maintained it as directly, and only used cartridges from the manufacturer. It has been designed to fail on purpose after two years to force you to purchase a new one, which explains the price being so low.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Bad Product, not worth your money
customer_reviews.text: Bad buy, would not get again. First things first, the printer loses connection to the wifi all the time, making printing very hard. So, I have a home network with access points, so I attach it to that. Oh, well now it can't find itself. So I configure it and try to print, no luck. So I factory reset the machine, reinstall software, and try again. Nope, still won't print. I cann tech support, and while they were nice, their ultimate solution was for send a technician out to me. This is ridiculous. I wouldn't buy this printer again, and maybe I'd stay away from the company overall.
customer_reviews.author: Sam Broadwater

customer_reviews.title: Not at all like the older Canon printers
customer_reviews.text: Not at all like the older Canon printers. Very hard to set up initially, and 2 months of using very little, paper started getting jammed all of the time. You have to keep adjusting the tray. Very undependable. I will be getting another printer, but not sure about another Pixma. Additional info: I got a replacement for the previous one that didn't work and it doesn't work properly either. It says there is an error but none show up. So I cannot use this printer either. Awful product, I will never buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Andy J

customer_reviews.title: Scanner does NOT with Mac!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I needed a wireless printer and I like their ink policy-- you can still print in B&W if a color runs out, and you can use third party inks. I was able to set up wireless printing on my Macbook Pro (running El Capitan) but I could never get the computer to recognize the scanner. I tried for 3 hours (including 1 hour with Canon technical support). I even watched a Youtube video specifically about setting up an MX492 on a Mac but no dice. I returned it today and will purchase an HP instead. Very disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: IMHO

customer_reviews.title: I've had 2 other manufactorer's printers that worked just fine through this same computer
customer_reviews.text: Would not connect to my wifi because my passcode has numbers in it and it would only allow letters. I called customer service and they could not answer my question but only would help me by remoting on through my computer. Tried that and when they couldn't get it done tried to charge me money for some firewall I suddenly magically needed! I've had 2 other manufactorer's printers that worked just fine through this same computer! Won't buy Canon again!!!
customer_reviews.author: jennifer griffin

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Printer. As always, great Canon quality..
customer_reviews.text: Printer works perfectly. Don't really care about wireless, have it hooked up via usb. Printer came undamaged, thanks Amazon! And like all the Canon printers I've had before, simple setup, printing within 10 minutes. I didn't use the installation cd that came with it, just downloaded the drivers directly from CanonUSA. Maybe people like all the extras the cd has, for me I just want the drivers to get the printer working. Excellent print quality, if anyone says it's not, they need glasses! The other nice thing, none of that ridiculous multi ink tank cartridges! Just one for color (3 colors in one package) and 1 black. Again, I like simplicity..
customer_reviews.author: reviewer9090

customer_reviews.title: This is the worst printer I have every used
customer_reviews.text: This is the worst printer I have every used. It never connects. It never responds. Whenever it does do something the response on the screen is "Wait a while". I've only managed to print around 20 pages and it's already out of black ink. The papers I've printed were just text. The copy/scan works fine. I didn't try the fax. It's a cheap printer for a reason. You will regret purchasing this printer.
customer_reviews.author: Michael L.

customer_reviews.title: Stopped working, no returns.
customer_reviews.text: Have had this 3 months. Stopped working wirelessly so I bought and hooked up the USB and it won’t run at all. Tried for three days to figure out what’s wrong with three other people and we cannot figure it out. Now I see there is no returns or exchanges?! 3 months and now I own a paper weight basically. Thanks a lot. :(
customer_reviews.author: Harmony Jane

customer_reviews.title: Will not buy Canon again. DO NOT BUY! Worthless after a PAPER JAM!
customer_reviews.text: A paper jam sent this printer into a non-useable state. And it's not even designed for you to retrieve the piece of paper from parts of the printer. After I somehow managed to fish out the piece of paper, then it would constantly tell me to load paper, after failing to reel in paper... It's completely useless now.
customer_reviews.author: Richard Howard

customer_reviews.title: Worse printer ever!!!
customer_reviews.text: After reading reviews for different color printers, I decided to give this one a try. Boy, was I wrong. Worked seamlessly for a month, then the printer nightmare started. This printer is moody. Sometimes it will not want to print, paper gets jammed sheet after sheet, prints without paper so it makes a wonderful ink soup. If it prints, its completely crooked and it has been calibrated many times. Its not worth the time. I need to buy a better printer.
customer_reviews.author: Frances O.

customer_reviews.title: Dont buy if you need to scan multiple documents, it skips
customer_reviews.text: If you plan on scanning multiple pages at once then don't buy this printer. I have repeatedly attempted to scan 10 pages and it pulls multiple pages, when it works that is, half the time the "image garden" wont even load. As a printer it's a mostly affordable option but you can get just a plain printer for cheaper. If I had learned about the sub par document feeder earlier I would have returned it in a heartbeat. For the price and functionality, it's just not worth it.
customer_reviews.author: HD Communications

customer_reviews.title: World's okayest bargain printer, but the software requirement is so 2003.
customer_reviews.text: Good printer for the money. A little noisy, but a real bargain. Canon requires some bloatware to be installed on your system, if you have a desktop computer, which is a pain because I don't want their software on my computer for a simple print function. However, the print quality is ok, the scanner works alright, and generally it's a good basic printer that you can count on to do the job.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew W

customer_reviews.title: Don't update the firmware
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for a couple of years. Everything was going great with it until tonight. After being pestered into updating the firmware for the last month, I decided to do it. Immediately after doing it, it wouldn't recognize my third-party ink cartridges. Canon does this to force you into buying their ink cartridges. There is no way to rollback the firmware update. Rather than give in to Canon, I decided to trash the printer instead. I will never buy a Canon product for as long as I shall live. If you like your printer, do not update the firmware.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Cuthbert

customer_reviews.title: piece of junk
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this in June 2018. One month later the paper got jammed and the entire printer broke. I called Canon and since there was no way to fix it they sent me a replacement. The paper got jammed again in Sept. and the machine broke again. I requested that Canon just send me another model since I went through 2 printers in 4 months. After telling me no and then going through supervisors I was granted my request. I'm getting the new model soon so hopefully that was will be more reliable. Don't waste your money!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Rubbo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for employment advertisement and for employees
customer_reviews.text: I love the printer it was an all-in-one printer that have fax copy print and scan it didn't malfunction at all and it gave perfect use it lasted for like 4 years and what happened was they told me that I should put a certain ink in there when I called the manufacturer and I bought it from them it didn't fit the printer and it messed up the printer and messed up the whole machine actually so I got a whole new scan head and I just didn't like the printer anymore so I basically tossed it cuz it was like new anymore and I got another one.
customer_reviews.author: Tanya Monique Willis

customer_reviews.title: Best value for the price - who knew it could do it all?
customer_reviews.text: I bought this printer over a year ago when I wasn't working strictly because the price was low and I could copy and scan. Fast forward to 2020 and I'm unexpectedly working at home needing to copy and scan letter size and legal size documents. The document feeder lets me scan a stack of pages without feeding them in one by one and the copy quality is decent. Kind of a pain to have to switch the settings from legal to regular sized paper, but, for the $40 I spent on this, I couldn't be happier. Who knew?
customer_reviews.author: LM

customer_reviews.title: I agree with prior reviews... this is Canon's worst printer
customer_reviews.text: Problems started with frequent pager jams... recently, printout had missing characters. I spent 3 days trying to trouble shoot and align the print heads... ran out of ink and got 1 day delivery from Amazon. Put in the new cartridges... Problem did not go away.... Tried to remove and reinstall the printer with latest software. If anything, after a hour or so, the problem did not go away... if anything, it got worst.... Even got a paper jam when trying to scan my most recent test page... Now I've got 2 new ink cartridges and can't use them.
customer_reviews.author: Leo RI

customer_reviews.title: EH.
customer_reviews.text: For the price, it's to be expected. I've learned the hard way I want a monochromatic toner printer. If you run out of color ink with this model, there's no easy way to just default the printing to black\white (well, just black technically). You have to constantly click through the printer settings each time you want to print something (on the computer) and set to gray scale. Then it KEEPS alerting you you're out of or running low on color ink. You can't just leave the color ink cartridge out, it'll freak out and not work. It's cheap... worked for a time but I'll be going with a toner printer.
customer_reviews.author: Danielle Airaghi

customer_reviews.title: Great for printing stuff off your phone
customer_reviews.text: Its nice to have a wireless printer in the house. We use ours to print forms, manuals, and other stuff directly from our phones, iPad, and computer. It was easy to set up and it works well. Ink cartridges are expensive but there are 3rd-party brands out there who offer cartridges to fit this printer that cost a lot less and function just fine. Search for the cartridge size/model of your original and you should find plenty of alternatives. I like the concept of buying recycled cartridges, and have had good luck with them so far. Let me know if you find any of this helpful.
customer_reviews.author: AKMonkeyTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Easy to setup.
customer_reviews.text: Just received it. Took about 5 minutes to set up using my phone. Just go to the google app store and search for "pixma" it's called "cannon print" or something. 10m downloads. Wifi / NFC beam / Wired. Everything has tape to keep it in place during shipping, be sure to remove. Printed shipping label no problem. 'A4 paper and 11x8 "plain paper" resolution was low, maybe printing on full res / high quality would be more appropriate for this sort of thing. Regardless, easy, came with color and black ink. Relatively short power cord & printer cable included.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan H.

customer_reviews.title: Decent Budget Wireless Printer - Works Well
customer_reviews.text: It works as a budget wireless printer. You don't spend this little and expect super quality prints or fast silent printing. Yes the printer is kind of loud, it also doesn't print the fastest. But I've had this printer setup for general printing and shipping label creation, it has worked fine without a problem. The printer sits in another room outside my office. The wireless works fine, I've had no issues with it. I don't expect a budget printer to last forever, but for how much I spent on it so far so good. I bought these OEM ink cartridges to save money btw
customer_reviews.author: Gavyne

customer_reviews.title: Fine for a low use Portable Scanner and Printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer easy to assemble . Getting working is time consuming as instructions are poor. Never could get wi-fi working. Very unclear instructions. Works best using Cableless setting. Could have saved an hour if used in that mode at beginning.. Print quality is fine but printer noisy. Scan works fine but difficult to change where documents are saved after scanning. Lots of softwear most of no use to us. Only using ScanGear and print drivers.. Deleted rest of apps. Using with three win 10 computers.. Goal was to have portable scanner and printer for one or two documents at at a time. Canon MX492 works fine for that function.
customer_reviews.author: Joe P

customer_reviews.title: All in one
customer_reviews.text: When my HP all in one gave up the ghost I had to find another one. I was going to get another HP until I saw this one wasn't sure about it but the price is what caught my eye and I am not sorry I got it. I am finding it to be better then my other one. All functions work great and its a bit smaller, lighter, and the ink cartridges are in the long run cheaper. So this one is a win win for me. I also installed it to my computer myself and that is something I have never done.
customer_reviews.author: Mary F. Stitely

customer_reviews.title: Canon MX492 Wireless All-IN-One Small Printer
customer_reviews.text: Nice little printer which I'm using to replace and HP Photosmart C309a (with a clogged up black nozzle that I can't clean) and an EPSON WF-7620 (with a failed switch on the scanner cover which is prohibiting me from replacing the ink cartridges). By the way the canon MX492 costs less than half the cost of a replacement set of ink cartridges for either the HP Photosmart C309a or the EPSON WF-7620. My only compliant is the feature in the key pad which shifts it between numeric, capitals, lowercase, and symbols (it is the * key)
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: All inkjet printers are a global conspiracy.
customer_reviews.text: Printing out things today is like using a fax machine or a landline phone. All these cheap inkjet printers are a global conspiracy for the ink cartels. This printer is cheap, not for photos, etc. I get the ink refilled at the big warehouse store that starts with C. The printer doesn't recognize the cartridge level anymore, I just have to wait to see when the ink starts to fade when printing. These cheap printers only last 3, 4, or 5 years, then off to be "recycled", which they're probably not and which is why our planet will die in a 100 years.
customer_reviews.author: Speegee

customer_reviews.title: I got what I paid for.
customer_reviews.text: I replaced an obsolete Canon printer with this one and I was shocked at what poor quality this is compared to my old one. It does not have a backlit screen, it is not a touch screen and it is unable to print two sided on it's own. I have yet to get it to scan to my computer and have tried and given up in frustration multiple times. It also randomly disconnects itself from the wifi and has to be manually reconnected. It performs basic print functions in color and black and white and it copies okay but it's definitely nothing to write home about.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle

customer_reviews.title: Cloud set up has been unsuccessful. I have followed ...
customer_reviews.text: Cloud set up has been unsuccessful. I have followed every set of instructions from Canon and Google, however the printer cannot seem to register for any cloud printing on either the Canon cloud print service nor the Google Cloud print service. It connects to the wifi network and functions from my iphone in Airprint mode. It momentarily printed from my Chromebook, but then stopped. The printer is discoverable but will not connect to the Chromebook for printing because it cannot register to the cloud. This printer is working well, but it is not high quality. It is satisfactory for most print jobs but I wouldn't depend on it for documents that need to be highly professional and pristine.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Not worth it.
customer_reviews.text: Its always out of paper even when its full. It takes me multiple times of reinserting the paper for it to work. Ive had Canon printers before. This one replaced one I had for eleven years that worked great until it sadly got flooded and died. Its been nothing but aggravation trying to print to print with this thing. Im just trying to print invoices so I can get paid.August 2020- Only prints green. Ive replace the color cartridges and black cartridge with Canon cartridges. Wasted them cleaning and diagnostics. Absolute junk. Will never buy Canon again. Swallowing hard and buying an HP.
customer_reviews.author: ITG Industries

customer_reviews.title: Complete ripoff...paid 48 bucks for one three years ago!
customer_reviews.text: Not only is the price here of over 360.00 amazingly ridiculous, but I have one I paid 48 bucks for on Amazon just about three years ago and it has NEVER worked right. Has never scanned, the wireless doesn't function - had to plug it in with a USB cord - and the color has never aligned right. Test pages will look perfect, but when you try to print in color? Wavy gravy. I wouldn't pay another 48 bucks for one, and to pay 367 for one now??? That's nuts.
customer_reviews.author: WMF

customer_reviews.title: Junk - PASS!
customer_reviews.text: Junk. Used maybe 4 times in 6 months. No issues at first. Went to start up printer, after making sure was fully charged, no response. Screen would not turn on. Both printer and charger were kept up on a shelf in a closet, so I know nothing happened to them. Tried another charger from another Canon printer previously purchased, that did not work either. Could not get in touch with anybody when looking to troubleshoot. Waste of money. Do not recommend, will leave you stranded when you need it
customer_reviews.author: AmazonAddict

customer_reviews.title: Now I don't have to use my PC to print Etsy shipping labels and packing slips
customer_reviews.text: I can now print off my Etsy packing slips and shipping labels without my PC, thanks to this printer. I just setup Google Cloud Print, and now I can stop using the old slow PC I've been using to print/ship everything. So, no more security updates or waiting for my old slow PC to load a page - I just do everything on my phone browser and print everything I need right from there. Print quality is good, speed is average, easy-to-setup and use wireless feature made my day.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Don't Buy This Printer if you value your time.
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really a fan of this printer. It print okay, but the whole reason that I got it was for the wireless feature. It has worked a few times, but programming it is not intuitive and it randomly loses the wireless settings when you turn the computer off. It's more convenient for me to just take my laptop to my USB printer instead of spending an hour running back and forth from my modem to this printer trying to reprogram it. I'm going to try to sell it on Craigslist and let it be someone else's headache.
customer_reviews.author: Christian Omari Robbins

customer_reviews.title: A perfect home printer
customer_reviews.text: This printer/copier/scanner does everything I need it to do. I love it so much that not only have I purchased one for myself, but since having it, have also gifted one to my parents, my sister, and my grandma. For someone who is pretty tech savvy, the set-up instructions are pretty easy to follow; however, my grandma really struggled with set-up and needed me to come over and help her get it all set up and connected. I think it's reasonably priced, relatively easy to use, and has given me no issues (or any of my family members) since purchase; therefore, I'm giving it all 5 stars.
customer_reviews.author: Kayla

customer_reviews.title: P.O.S.!!  Worst printer i ever bought.
customer_reviews.text: P.O.S.! Worst printer I have ever bought. Never even got to try it out. In the setup, you link it to your wifi. However, while doing this the printer will kick out your wifi password and replace it with its own 36 character password, that you don't even know. So then you cannot reconnect to your own wifi, with any of your devises. So you have to call your Internet provider to have them reset your password, because Canon can't help you with that. What the crap!?!. So I bought an HP wifi printer. It connected to my wifi with no problems at all. And it works great. I will never buy another Canon printer. I recommend you don't either.
customer_reviews.author: David T. Martinsville, VA.

customer_reviews.title: Great machine, awful documentation
customer_reviews.text: UPDATE: Just discovered that ALL configuration can be done via the (tiny) LCD display and keypad. I never have to interact with the awful CD-ROM configurator again! Plus one star! 5 star hardware, 3 star software, manual that should be flushed down the crapper. Network setup was a cluster f***, mostly due to vague, contradictory, and outdated documentation.
customer_reviews.author: Chris S.

customer_reviews.title: Good for the Price
customer_reviews.text: When I got this it was $50. I knew what I was getting into with a $50 printer. Generally, it will obey and do as instructed with little difficulty. The menus can be aggravating, and at times it will simply refuse me and print a blank page. It is also considerably inefficient on ink as well. However, for a $50 printer, it is remarkable. A lot of issues were avoided whenever I installed all of the software related to the printer. I would not spend more than $60 on this, and would encourage people to look elsewhere for that kind of price, however.
customer_reviews.author: Melody Rindfuss

customer_reviews.title: Best Home Printer
customer_reviews.text: Bought this 2 years ago and its still going good. Perfect for home/daily use. Wireless capability is great easy and seamless. The printer can print noise less and the black color is subtle. It can hold 20 sheets. The print quality is nice. One thing i don't like about it is that it can use a little more amount of ink than other brands maybe to produce that high quality prints. But overall a very reliable printer which can be wirelessly used thru AIRPRINT, Google print, and canon print app. This is also energy star certified. Highly recommended product!!!
customer_reviews.author: M. Razi Hussain

customer_reviews.title: Good mid-price, relatively "simple" printer
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer now for a couple weeks. The price was great (saw the same printer at Target for $99). The set-up was a tad time-consuming but the instructions were easy to follow. It is not the fastest printer ever, but it's perfectly fine for my needs. If you need a printer for personal use, or perhaps some not-too-strenuous home business concerns, this is a good choice. However, if you do a lot of high-volume printing and need something that churns out printed pages quickly, I'd recommend spending a bit more money on a higher-end printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Rudd

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly good little printer!
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about purchasing such a low priced printer, but I have been very happy with it. To be fair, I do not print a lot, so if you're a heavy printer I don't know if this is a good option for you. I use it to print out monthly receipts, and random documents. Again, not a lot but works great for me.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole K

customer_reviews.title: WORST PRINTER EVER
customer_reviews.text: One of the worst printers I have ever encountered. The print quality is terrible and the scanning quality is even worse; I have cleaned it several times but it continues to have lines on the scan. And that's when it ACTUALLY scans! Most times it tells me it isn't connected, or it jams the papers, or the paper feed doesn't even work, causing me to have to scan each page one by one on the glass. The buttons and overall feel of the printer is just cheap, clunky and lightweight.
customer_reviews.author: Chelsea

customer_reviews.title: Cannot print directly from phone. Needs Wi-Fi
customer_reviews.text: I thought I'd be able to print straight from my phone to the printer w/o an external internet connection but this is not the case. You need a wifi to connect your phone to, then connect the printer to the same wifi and then they can communicate with each other to print. Also not happy that I had to install a cannon printer app that has no print preview option and I can't get my printings to fill the whole page...The printer itself seems nice enough but I regret buying this.
customer_reviews.author: M. Steger

customer_reviews.title: Good quality and prints nice photos
customer_reviews.text: Got this printer so I can print photos. It was a great price and it is a solid product. I haven’t had a printer in 10 years and was always asking people to print things for me so I decided to buy my own and it was a great purchase. It prints great quality photos and I use the scanner feature a lot. I love that I can buy ink for it from different manufacturers on amazon and they fit and work perfect with it. It syncs really easy with my laptop, my daughters laptop, iPad and iPhones. Now I don’t know what I’d do without a printer!
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: No issues after a month
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to print off coloring book pages for my niece and nephew when they are over. The printer works great for my use. I just followed the instructs that come with it and I have had no issues with connecting it to my network (I run a mesh wifi network). It does feel cheap and plasticky, but I was not going to spend more then I did on a printer for light crafting. We have used it off and on for a month now and we still have plenty of ink left and I have had no issues with network connectivity. I would not purchase this thinking it was going to a quality photo printer.
customer_reviews.author: Kasey Berry

customer_reviews.title: Does a fine job
customer_reviews.text: I really like this little printer. At this price, you don't expect top-of-the-line, though. It is compact and it has all the features that I need - printing, copying, scanning, faxing, etc. But it is relatively slow and doesn't have a large paper capacity. If you want to close the machine up, you have to remove the paper supply, as it cannot fit inside. However, it prints well and reproduces electronic photos with remarkable color and clarity. The instructions for assembly were a royal pain, with some information apparently missing and some information difficult to decipher. But I got through it and all is forgiven.
customer_reviews.author: Waltzing Matilda

customer_reviews.title: Reliable Product!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second printer just like this. The previous printer like this lasted for 3 years and worked very well. I do not use the fax machine part of this product, but the scanner, printer, and copier are very easy to use. Set up was very easy to use from wireless devices--even my iPhone. I bought this second one because I needed to replace both color and black ink and honestly, with this great price, it was cheaper just to get a whole new set up! I would definitely recommend. When things have gone wrong, the troubleshooting guide is very easy to use and helpful.
customer_reviews.author: Karr

customer_reviews.title: Constantly answers my phone.
customer_reviews.text: Update: Still answers my phone while in conversation. Goes through ink like Dracula through blood. often locks up. Stay away from this. I ended up tossing my previous Canon after several years as it would no longer print. But that's not this Canon. With this canon, a problem which many people are familiar with: the fax machine answers my phone a couple of minutes into any phone conversation. My callers get cut off. I've gone through the configuration, but to no avail. This happened with my previous Canon, although it took a couple of years to break down. This one (the MX492) answering my bloody phone right out of the box. Otherwise it does the job it's supposed to.
customer_reviews.author: S. Gabie

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer with a great price
customer_reviews.text: It was a little difficult to set up, which surprised me because I have set up many wireless printers before. But it's now working and I love it. The printing quality is great. And the scans are the best I've ever had. Warning - be sure to call Canon's Tech Support when you need help. The first time I called I mistakenly called a 3rd party firm in India who wanted to charge me $150 just to talk to me! Tech support is free!
customer_reviews.author: Laurel S. Druce

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: I have used Canon printers for years, after this one I will never buy one again. This is used as a home printer, it doesn't get a lot of use, it has always had paper jams often and now it has already stopped working keeps giving my error 1401 which means you there is a problem with the ink cartridges, I have replaced both and still get the same error message, so now the printer is useless since it will not pick up that new cartridges have been installed.
customer_reviews.author: D. P.

customer_reviews.title: Great little printer.
customer_reviews.text: Setup was pretty easy. Everything was explained in the directions. A black and a color ink cartridge were both included. Love that I can print using my phone. The only con is that it's a bit loud, but most printers are and my baby sleeps through it so I don't mind. Overall, I'm really happy with it considering it's an all-in-one and was only $50.
customer_reviews.author: Elmo

customer_reviews.title: Worst printer I have owned
customer_reviews.text: Worst printer I have owned. Can not connect to phone, WiFi, computer to save my life. Have tried online support, pretty much read every trick, gave up, tried again, repeat. Waiting to long to return, so I am S.O.L., are my loss, and bought a different printer today. I don’t ask for much in a printer; just to be able to connect to my phone to print return labels and the occasional recipe I find. Do not recommend unless you want extreme frustration, with a lot of disappointment.
customer_reviews.author: Megan Blake

customer_reviews.title: Great, cheap printer
customer_reviews.text: Printer is exactly what I was looking for. I didn’t want anything super high tech or expensive, it’s just to print off stuff from the computer. I haven’t hooked it up to air print yet but as it is, it works great. My only issue is that the black is not black. It’s more of a dark grey shade. It does come with 2 Ink cartridges, one color and one black and that’s what I’m currently using now so once they run out, I’ll get new ones and see if that fixes the lighter black shade problem. Other than that, it’s a great printer for the price.
customer_reviews.author: Kandy Buesa

customer_reviews.title: So far this printer has been fantastic! I just used it to print 100+ envelops ...
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this printer to have at home and mainly because my wedding was approaching and I wanted to use it to do at home printing than through a service provider. So far this printer has been fantastic! I just used it to print 100+ envelops so I didn't have to hand address them and I had no issues at all with the printer or printing perfectly onto the envelops! I've used it for copying as well and it works fantastic. I had no issues with the wireless set up and love that even more! Depending upon the type of printing you need, this is a great at home printer as well as great value for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Not compatible with Mac computers
customer_reviews.text: I didn't notice anywhere in the description that this printer wasn't compatible with Mac computers (although admittedly I didn't look for that specific information but did read over the specs). I was able to get it to successfully print from the iPhone app but wireless printing from the Mac is not possible. Setup is really tedious because the screen on the printer is so small and limited in information. I loved the price point of the printer but it was much more limited in functionality than I realized, so we returned it for an upgraded model.
customer_reviews.author: Alex

customer_reviews.title: It's a Printer
customer_reviews.text: So far I have not had a problem with the printer except for the wireless connection. I had to connect it from my phone first because for some reason I couldn't connect from my Mac even though it came with instructions the process seemed a lot more difficult to do it from there. It's probably easier from a regular Windows computer. So if you have a problem connecting it to a Mac laptop/computer I suggest try to do it from your phone and then connect it to your computer. Also the usb connection option they should have included an actually usb cord. (It does come with ink)
customer_reviews.author: _chasingclouds_

customer_reviews.title: Nice Printer For The Money
customer_reviews.text: Once you figure out how to set up the features, it has worked great. We've scanned and printed documents with it. I've printed from my LG Stylo 3 phone, my laptop and from my iPad. The color printing is good too. The footprint is smaller than my other Cannon which leaves more room on my desk. So far it's been worth every penny of the $40 I paid for it.
customer_reviews.author: Matlyn J.

customer_reviews.title: Compared to MX470 series, not as good
customer_reviews.text: Purchased 6/19/18, I was replacing an older model of the same which developed some weird problems when scanning through the auto feeder but not on the flatbed. Yet, I had that one for years. This one is less than one year and it's developing an obvious mechanical issue with the feeder. Granted the price is cheap but scanning via auto feeder is one of the two main things I do. The older model was still printing fine until it ran out of ink not too long ago. And, I honestly wasn't scanning all that much but I'm back to where I started except out of some $$ and some patience.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua P

customer_reviews.title: Poor customer service hours
customer_reviews.text: Printer came with installation instruction which were vague. I had problems setting up printer and it prints and copies well. Tried to get installation help by phone and they give assistance only through regular business hours.....Mon-Fri 8-5.....which is not acceptable. Today good manufacturers provide 24/7 customer service, and most folks are working those hours. Will not purchase Canon product again until they modify customer assistance 24/7. Too many other printer manufacturers that are more customer oriented.
customer_reviews.author: Jerry B. Andrews

customer_reviews.title: Happy I ordered it
customer_reviews.text: I've had this for over a month and a really good printer. Haven't used fax yet but sure it will be ok. I was a little nervous reading reviews about the set up but I breezed through it until I got to the alignment part.. Called Steve from Customer Service he walked me through it and it worked out great. I used the instructions online they were easier than the instructions they sent me. Printing from my iPhone is so very easy also. Happy I got it
customer_reviews.author: Maryann Cellucci

customer_reviews.title: Way too difficult to configure for one lone laptop at home
customer_reviews.text: I'm pretty computer savvy, but after hours of trying to get this set up, I gave up, and returned it. Permissions issues, networking (Homegroup) issues, firewall issues, one after another. Couldn't even copy all of the installation disk that came with it because of these conflicts. Couldn't download and open drivers and utilities from the web for the same reason. Couldn't get it to connect with my laptop with a printer USB cord, or change from wireless to USB. Now I see why "professional setup" was an option at the time of purchase. It shouldn't be this hard. Back it goes.
customer_reviews.author: Kitten Entropy

customer_reviews.title: basics work
customer_reviews.text: Keeps going off internet and have to continually re-connect, so can use wireless functions. Frustrating. View panel is on top, hard to get to and read without lighting, should be on front like most printers. Also, the functions are hard to get used to, not logical. Noisy, and slow to respond. Does make very good copies. Two-sided function works well. Re-manufactured ink cartridges are a bit pricey, compared to some other brands. A bit slower than comparable models.
customer_reviews.author: Doctor Rick

customer_reviews.title: A Nice Little Copier
customer_reviews.text: My big old HP scanner/copier died and since I don't have a great deal of things to copy or scan, I thought this little copier would fill my needs. The Canon does a nice job for the few printing jobs I have. The scanner works well but it is a bit difficult to operate and if I don't use it very often, I forget where I have to go and what I have to do to get the scanner working. If it weren't for the scanner being tricky to operate, I would give the little Cannon scanner/copier a five star rating instead of a four star rating.
customer_reviews.author: Johno

customer_reviews.title: WORST printer ever
customer_reviews.text: I am sorely disappointed by this printer. It gets jammed ALL the time. The ink runs out QUICKLY. And the worst part: it has an automatic shut off. Why bother having a wireless printer if you have to go turn it on every time you have to print? Terrible printer.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the scan feature works fine and the printing is good quality
customer_reviews.text: I have had the printer for a couple months now and would not buy it again. As a printer, even after running the setup program multiple times, it will show a "Wait a While" message if you want to print something from the computer. The only cure I've found is to shut the thing off up until right before you want to print and then shutting it off when you're done until the next time you need to print something. When it works, the scan feature works fine and the printing is good quality. The wait a while issue is maddening, however. I tried it both connecting to the computer with a cable and wireless, that doesn't make any difference.
customer_reviews.author: Glen Moegenburg

customer_reviews.title: It's does it all the basics that I need it to. Also nice that it's wireless.
customer_reviews.text: It's does it all the basics that I need it to. If I'm cut off from mooching from work, I resort to this. Also scans individual documents and batches/stacks of documents. Kind of loud and slow. Also nice that it's wireless.
customer_reviews.author: Mike

customer_reviews.title: Idiot proof wireless set up
customer_reviews.text: This is my favorite printer I've ever owned. My last printer I never figured out how to set it up to print wirelessly, I mean maybe I'm the idiot or maybe the instructions were just garbage. Although it was also a Canon. But this one had the easiest set up instructions and literally made it idiot proof which was awesome for me.
customer_reviews.author: Joshlyn

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME bluetooth printer!!
customer_reviews.text: AWESOME bluetooth printer!! I bought it for my father-in-law who owns a small business and his office printer broke and he was in need of a new printer. He lives in a fairly large house and he told me he can send stuff to print directly from his iphone via bluetooth when he is upstairs all the way to the printer that is down stairs in the garage (his office is in the garage)!!! He is amazed by this printer, LOL. He prints stuff for his business on a daily basis and has never experienced any type of issues with this printer so far. GREAT quality for the price!!!
customer_reviews.author: AnileyR

customer_reviews.title: excellent for the price
customer_reviews.text: They just do not make home-business printers like they used to. This one, for the price (on sale $39, free shipping, and including 2 ink cartridges), should be fine for me. It works. Need to treat it gently. Unlike days gone by, the unit, trays, all moving parts are made with quite-flimsy materials. As long as it prints - small jobs - I am happy.
customer_reviews.author: william

customer_reviews.title: WOW AMAZING!!
customer_reviews.text: ITS AMAZING I HIGHLY RECOMMEND YOU DON'T BUY THIS.WOW COMPLETLY SHOCKED AT THE DIFFICULTY IT TAKES JUST TO SET UP. Received this today started to try to set up nothing helped the website did not help either watched videos still having difficulty with printing. I downloaded the app but it keeps saying I need to add paper which I filled and adjusted as instructed in the videos same message pops up needs paper I added the settings for the paper type. I will edit this once I continue to work with this I will give it a chance.
customer_reviews.author: kimberly

customer_reviews.title: Jams easily, and in our case fatally
customer_reviews.text: The worst part of this printer is that it does not make it easy to load the paper--either it's too far inside or not far enough--and it jams if you do it wrong. In our case, one jam was too many, and even though we cleaned it out thoroughly, now no matter what we do it jams with the first sheet. Printing quality is also variable, sometimes the blacks are very light. And it eats up cartridges, which cost half as much as the printer. All in all, a piece of garbage. Spend a little more money and get something that was designed by actual engineers.
customer_reviews.author: Music and Tech Guy

product_meta.title: Canon MX492 Black Wireless All-IN-One Small Printer with Mobile or Tablet Printing, Airprint and Google Cloud Print Compatible
product_meta.description: Small Footprint and Business Quality Printing right from your Smartphone or Tablet
feature_bullets: We are here for you with 100 percent US based Service & Support
Save time with the fully integrated Auto Document Feeder
Print and scan photos or documents from your mobile device using the free Canon PRINT app
Air Print: Print wirelessly and effortlessly from your compatible iPhone, iPad or iPod touch no drivers needed
The space saving small printer fits about anywhere in your home, office or dorm

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars6,673 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
